model_answer:
We refer to Wikipedia articles on marketing for help. The correct chronological order is: (1) The host greets and asks viewers to subscribe. (2) The host instructs to open Facebook Menu → Settings. (3) The host shows how to access the Help Center article “What names are allowed on Facebook?”. (4) The host explains the process of converting a profile to a page and mentions monetization. (5) The host displays the Help Centre “Pages” screen. (6) In Help Center feedback, “The solution doesn’t work” is chosen.

Therefore, the answer is (C).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on online video tutorials for help. The events should be in chronological order of when they occur in the video. First, the host mentions that they have copied their profile and will paste it, then tells the audience to tap submit on the feedback form. Next, a 'Thanks for watching' end screen appears with an EDM outro. Then, the Help Center's 'Pages' section opens on mobile after being instructed to click, showing page management information. After that, the host explains how to copy the profile link by tapping the three dots on the profile screen. A red warning advises to create a Page instead of changing a personal name, while the host suggests creating or converting to a page. Next, a message reading “Hello Facebook team, I want to convert my Facebook profile to a Facebook page…” is typed and submitted. Lastly, in the Help Center, the user navigates to “Fix a problem” and selects “The solution doesn’t work,” opening a text box.

Therefore, the answer is (C).
